column1: 7.1.3.4	  Summary of evidence and recommendations for radical and partial nephrectomy techniques
Offer laparoscopic radical nephrectomy (RN) to patients with T2 tumours and localised   masses not treatable by partial nephrectomy (PN).
Do not perform minimally-invasive RN in patients with T1 tumours for whom a PN is feasible   by any approach, including open.
Do not perform minimally-invasive surgery if this approach may compromise oncological-  functional- and peri-operative outcomes.
Intensify follow-up in patients with a positive surgical margin, especially in upstaged pT3a   patients.
